repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Public Health Surveillance and
            Disease Control Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the Public Health
            Surveillance and Disease Control Project were as follows:
            the outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was low, the Bank's performance was
            satisfactory and the Borrower's performance was also
            satisfactory. The lessons learned included the following:
            (1) the Project showed that the achievements of the
            activities and their sustainability were strengthened when
            it was able to work in coordination with other national
            agencies (INDEC, other Secretariats or Ministries); (2) the
            usefulness of the funding mechanisms to finance the
            Subprojects was apparent and although their social or
            sanitary impact was reduced, they serve as producers of
            local capabilities that strengthen the development of
            national and provincial policies; (3) an adjustment of the
            administrative procedures and the strengthening of local
            management capacities is needed, in order to successfully
            complete these sub-projects; (4) the strategy used through
            the operational research projects and the support provided
            to the municipalities made it possible to expand the public
            capacity and mobilize civil society resources; and (5) one
            of the principal lessons in the relation with the provinces
            is the need to structure a national surveillance and health
            promotion system with sufficient resources and active
            presence beyond the weaknesses of the institutional capacity
            of the provinces.

440140.trustfund:

            SURVEILLANCE AND DISEASE CONTROL,TF036448-ARGENTINA - COMMUNICABLE DISEASES,TF036447-ARGENTINA - COMMUNICABLE DISEASES

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Public Health Surveillance and
            Disease Control Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Public Health
            Surveillance and Disease Control Project in Argentina is to
            strengthen national, provincial, municipal, and institutions
            responsible for public health policy and practice. The
            components call for: 1) strengthening the public health
            surveillance system, to be implemented nationally. It will
            strengthen the Ministry of Health and Social Action (MSAS)
            institutional capacity, in order to make informed decisions
            on prevention control, better monitor changes in health
            trends, and allocate resources effectively. 2) Improved
            disease control, will be strengthened through institutional
            building at provincial levels, to better monitor disease,
            control and prevent such diseases. Namely, febrile
            illnesses, such as tuberculosis and dengue, in high
            incidence areas will be controlled, as well as other
            infectious and emergent diseases. 3) The health promotion
            component will strengthen MSAS capacity, to implement a
            strategic promotion on health, through education, social
            mobilization, and policy advocacy. Training will be provided
            for dissemination practices, and required infrastructure
            rehabilitation and equipment, will be provided under this
            component. 4) Administrative costs will finance the Project
            Coordinating Unit over a four year period.
